result.execSummary:
The defendant Earl B Hall Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County with NO Electronic Monitoring.
1 day credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 2

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge is to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
No violent contact with the victim.
Provide DNA sample of not previously done.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Order for Early Discharge from Probation
Request for Early Discharge from Probation
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Earl B Hall in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting for his client to complete some counseling. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Earl B Hall in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with B. H. listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim or any family member.

Defendant Earl B Hall in court, in custody, with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
